dr.xml
Class KeyboardInput

java.lang.Object
  dr.xml.KeyboardInput

 class KeyboardInput
extends java.lang.Object

A simple input class to read values typed at the command line. If an error occurs during input, any exceptions thrown are caught and a default value returned.

Version:
1.2 Oct 2002
Author:
Graham Roberts, Russel Winder

Field Summary
private  java.io.BufferedReader in
          The buffered stream that connects to the keyboard so that we can read from it sensibly.

The buffered stream that connects to the keyboard so that we can read from it sensibly.

KeyboardInput

KeyboardInput()
Method Detail

readInteger

public final int readInteger()
Read an int value from keyboard input.

Returns:
The integer value read in, or zero if the input was invalid.

readLong

public final long readLong()
Read a long value from keyboard input.

Returns:
The long value read in, or 0L if the input was invalid.

readDouble

public final double readDouble()
Read a double value from keyboard input.

Returns:
The double value read in, or 0.0 if the input was invalid.

readFloat

public final float readFloat()
Read a float value from keyboard input.

Returns:
The float value read in, or 0.0F if the input was invalid.

readCharacter

public final char readCharacter()
Read a char value from keyboard input.

Returns:
The char value read in, or ' ' (space) if the input was invalid.

readString

public final java.lang.String readString()
Read an String value from keyboard input.

Returns:
The String value read in.
